Annie returns from the forest and begins her third year at the Court. Her experience has left her changed, causing Kat to worry as they both struggle to find their place while their life changes around them. Together with their friends, they start to form a plan of action to deal with the tortured ghost they encountered the previous year, and in doing so, help Robot and Shadow form a new bond after a terrible accident. Annie continues to develop her powers and even takes part in a class full of former-fairies and animals, while Kat uncovers the mysteries of the ancient Court robots. Meanwhile, the search for the next Court Medium is drawing to a close, bringing with it new dangers and new revelations about the people Annie and Kat have met.\n\nContains chapters 32-41 of the       <div id="aboutAuthor" class=" clearFloats bigBox"><div class="h2Container gradientHeaderContainer"><h2 class="brownBackground"><a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson">About Kelly Thompson</a></h2></div><div class="bigBoxBody"><div class="bigBoxContent containerWithHeaderContent">
          <div class='bookAuthorProfile'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__topContainer'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__photoContainer'>
<a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson"><div class='bookAuthorProfile__photo' style='background-image: url(https://images.gr-assets.com/authors/1423557636p3/6543330.jpg);'></div>
</a></div>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__widgetContainer'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__name'>
<a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson">Kelly Thompson
</a></div>
<div class='goodreadsAuthorBadge'></div>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__followerCount'>
348
followers
</div>

</div>
</div>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__about'>

<span id="freeTextContainer10440188155323682662">KELLY THOMPSON has a degree in Sequential Art from The Savannah College of Art &amp; Design. Her love of comics and superheroes have compelled her since she first discovered them as a teenager. Currently living in Portland, Oregon with her boyfriend and the two brilliant cats that run their lives, you can find Kelly all over the Internet where she is generally well liked, except where she's detest</span>
  <span id="freeText10440188155323682662" style="display:none">KELLY THOMPSON has a degree in Sequential Art from The Savannah College of Art &amp; Design. Her love of comics and superheroes have compelled her since she first discovered them as a teenager. Currently living in Portland, Oregon with her boyfriend and the two brilliant cats that run their lives, you can find Kelly all over the Internet where she is generally well liked, except where she's detested.<br /><br />Kelly has published two novels - THE GIRL WHO WOULD BE KING (2012) and STORYKILLER (2014) and the graphic novel HEART IN A BOX from Dark Horse Comics (2015). She's currently writing ROGUE &amp; GAMBIT, HAWKEYE, and PHASMA for Marvel Comics and GHOSTBUSTERS for IDW. Other major credits include: A-Force, Captain Marvel &amp; The Carol Corps, Jem and The Holograms, Misfits, Power Rangers Pink, and the creator-owned mini-series Mega Princess.<br /><br />Kelly's ambitions are eclipsed only by her desire to exist entirely in pajamas. Fortunately pajamas and writers go hand in hand (most of the time). Please buy all her stuff so that she can buy (and wear) more pajamas.</span>
  <a data-text-id="10440188155323682662" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

</div>
</div>

      $('bookCover_29844757').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_29844757').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_29844757').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });

          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);

    <h2>See a Problem?</h2>
    <div class="wrongBookText">
      <div class="description">

          <cite>Jem and the Holograms Vol. 1</cite> by Kelly Thompson.
      </div>

hidden\'>\nError rating book.       $('edition_25216223').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('edition_25216223').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('edition_25216223').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('edition_25216223').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

</script></div>

        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});

      });

        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

<div id="bookReviews">





  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section firstReview">


<div id="review_1698838134" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1698838134" />
    <a title="HFK" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/52263626-hfk"><img alt="HFK" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1485205375p2/52263626.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1698838134?book_show_action=true">Jul 15, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="HFK" class="user" itemprop="url" name="HFK" href="/user/show/52263626-hfk">HFK</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/52263626-hfk?shelf=paidkindle">paidkindle</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/52263626-hfk?shelf=graphics">graphics</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1698838134" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4123033463145146071">Awww, I too is one of the ladies who have fond and good memories of the original <i>Jem and the Holograms</i> comics, and I too is one of the ladies who felt a huge disappointment wave washing over my blood cells when the much talked Jem movie got out and ended up to be a really bad case of diarrhea mountain. What a fucking shame.<br><br>So yeah, almighty yeah, I was quite excited to discover Jem is making a comeback with a help of Kelly Thompson, and after finishing the first volume, I can say she did not cre</span>
  <span id="freeText4123033463145146071" style="display:none">Awww, I too is one of the ladies who have fond and good memories of the original <i>Jem and the Holograms</i> comics, and I too is one of the ladies who felt a huge disappointment wave washing over my blood cells when the much talked Jem movie got out and ended up to be a really bad case of diarrhea mountain. What a fucking shame.<br><br>So yeah, almighty yeah, I was quite excited to discover Jem is making a comeback with a help of Kelly Thompson, and after finishing the first volume, I can say she did not create this to disappoint us ladies, but to respect the legacy of all girly, all pink, all brains-out and relax, all the goodie goody. Sometimes it is just super nice to enjoy yourself something feminine, something that really cherishes all the goods and all the bads of womanhood, and there is absolutely no shame in it.<br><br>Being a mother of a 7-year old pain in the ass, having needing to see what is up in the world when comes to comics offered to the children, Jem still keeps being the diamond among the glitter and fluffy. Cute and adorable.<br><br>I am with Jem. I choose Jem.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469182673i/19789089.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>
  <a data-text-id="4123033463145146071" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1794579816" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1794579816" />
    <a title="Norah Una Sumner" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/28782884-norah-una-sumner"><img alt="Norah Una Sumner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1530897175p2/28782884.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1794579816?book_show_action=true">Oct 26, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Norah Una Sumner" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Norah Una Sumner" href="/user/show/28782884-norah-una-sumner">Norah Una Sumner</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=2016">2016</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=4-star-read">4-star-read</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=comics-manga-graphic-novels">comics-manga-graphic-novels</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=great-female-characters">great-female-characters</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=humor">humor</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=series">series</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=short-story">short-story</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28782884-norah-una-sumner?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1794579816" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer12880885568520986245"><b>3.5 stars</b><br /><br />Aww this was such a nice throwback! I love Jem and the Holograms and this first volume was really great. The art is beautiful but still urban and fun, the storyline is done nicely and it was really interesting to see this "new" Jem and her crew. I am looking forward to reading the next issue! Kelly and Ross did a great job with this classic. I felt like I was suddenly transferred to my childhood.</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1380586545" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1380586545" />
    <a title="Sesana" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5172893-sesana"><img alt="Sesana" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1413088169p2/5172893.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1380586545?book_show_action=true">Sep 01, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Sesana" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Sesana" href="/user/show/5172893-sesana">Sesana</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5172893-sesana?shelf=comics">comics</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5172893-sesana?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1380586545" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer30659248048346231">Jem was one of my favorite cartoons when I was a kid. When the DVDs came out a few years ago, I was happy to see that they basically held up. Not especially deep, no, but fun and sparkly as I remembered. Hearing about a comic book reboot, I was initially not sure if I wanted any part of it. But Thompson sounded so enthusiastic, and I was hearing really good things. So I actually bought each issue as it came out. This is really rare for me right now. And, as it turns out, an excellent choice.<br /><br />Jem</span>
  <span id="freeText30659248048346231" style="display:none">Jem was one of my favorite cartoons when I was a kid. When the DVDs came out a few years ago, I was happy to see that they basically held up. Not especially deep, no, but fun and sparkly as I remembered. Hearing about a comic book reboot, I was initially not sure if I wanted any part of it. But Thompson sounded so enthusiastic, and I was hearing really good things. So I actually bought each issue as it came out. This is really rare for me right now. And, as it turns out, an excellent choice.<br /><br />Jem is the best kind of reboot, one that knows what it's adapting and what made it successful in the first place. Which means that this version of Jem is, indeed, largely made of pink glitter. But that's what Jem is meant to be. And it was done by a creative team that obviously has a deep affection for the source material. Which leads to characters that are at once instantly recognizable and fresh. The most radical change, in my opinion, was to Rio, who actually becomes kind of amazing. He was... not a favorite of mine before. And I love that Kimber and Stormer finally get to have the adorable romance that I'm long since convinced the cartoon was hinting at. <br /><br />And the art is quite perfect, too. Campbell's character designs have the perfect style without being exact imitations of the original. I also love the diversity in the characters. I've long since lost count of the comics I've read where every female character has the exact same face. Campbell goes way beyond that by giving the characters diverse body types, as well. Tall and slender, short and curvy, and everything in between. It's really cool to see such a variety of women, all getting to be gorgeous and awesome. <br /><br />This take on Jem was everything I could have possibly hoped for. I want many, many more issues to come, because it makes me happy every time I get to read a new one.<br /><br />Re-read September 20, 2016. I still love it unreservedly. </span>
  <a data-text-id="30659248048346231" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1380213629" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1380213629" />
    <a title="Sh3llraiser" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25393430-sh3llraiser"><img alt="Sh3llraiser" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1532965407p2/25393430.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1380213629?book_show_action=true">Sep 01, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Sh3llraiser" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Sh3llraiser" href="/user/show/25393430-sh3llraiser">Sh3llraiser</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was ok"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25393430-sh3llraiser?shelf=graphic-novels-comics">graphic-novels-comics</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25393430-sh3llraiser?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25393430-sh3llraiser?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1380213629" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer7889103084646462172"><i>I received a digital copy of this from Netgalley to read and review.</i><br><br>Well, the illustrations were nice.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1441248068ra/16084011.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I was never a huge fan of Jem and the Holograms, but I liked it enough to be curious about this. Unfortunately, I found it very shallow and pretty much a carbon copy of the original cartoon except worse. They did make one of the supporting characters a lesbian, which I don't recall in the original show, and that's cool. It added some diversity and something different. But a lot of it was shallow</span>
  <span id="freeText7889103084646462172" style="display:none"><i>I received a digital copy of this from Netgalley to read and review.</i><br><br>Well, the illustrations were nice.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1441248068ra/16084011.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I was never a huge fan of Jem and the Holograms, but I liked it enough to be curious about this. Unfortunately, I found it very shallow and pretty much a carbon copy of the original cartoon except worse. They did make one of the supporting characters a lesbian, which I don't recall in the original show, and that's cool. It added some diversity and something different. But a lot of it was shallow and like one big girl fight.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1441248068ra/16084012.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>There was an Iron Man reference and I briefly thought, oh cool, but no. It was all angst and relationship drama and hardly any fantasy or sci-fi. Maybe it's just me. I think there's a movie coming out soon about this and it could just be a generic setup or something. Meh.<br></span>
  <a data-text-id="7889103084646462172" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1380213629'><a id="like_count_review_1380213629" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1380213629?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">23 likes</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F27797730-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">Like</a></span>

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1484833406" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1484833406" />
    <a title="Stephanie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6638503-stephanie"><img alt="Stephanie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1414086927p2/6638503.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1484833406?book_show_action=true">Dec 29, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Stephanie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Stephanie" href="/user/show/6638503-stephanie">Stephanie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1484833406" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer3613242536276966525">I kind of like the fact that I will be ending my 45 book year-long reading challenge with a comic book (and <i>Jem</i> no less!). <br /><br />In my tiny world, 2015 was the year of the comic book. It all started with the first collected volume of <i>Ms. Marvel</i> back in January and progressed to a full-on obsession. Things got serious when I started getting my single-issue comics bagged and boarded, when the guys at the comic book store greeted me by name, and when I started keeping track of my pull lists (you gotta be</span>
  <span id="freeText3613242536276966525" style="display:none">I kind of like the fact that I will be ending my 45 book year-long reading challenge with a comic book (and <i>Jem</i> no less!). <br /><br />In my tiny world, 2015 was the year of the comic book. It all started with the first collected volume of <i>Ms. Marvel</i> back in January and progressed to a full-on obsession. Things got serious when I started getting my single-issue comics bagged and boarded, when the guys at the comic book store greeted me by name, and when I started keeping track of my pull lists (you gotta be organized when those monthly solicitations come out, yo). <br /><br />I don't know why comic books have had such an impact on me this year--as, like, a human being and as a reader. Perhaps it is that I have found something in their pages that I couldn't find anywhere else. That coupling of art and story, characters I can readily identify with, an opening of the imagination. This arms-wide-open-love for comic books has helped me let other things in: other ways of thinking; genres I had previously been closed off to; new people and experiences.<br /><br />The thing is, most of the comics I read do not make it onto my Goodreads tally. There are just too many of them, it feels (to me) like I would be artificially inflating my year-end total. I have read some remarkable books, and the first collected volume of <i>Jem</i> is (seriously, I swear) one of them.<br /><br />A few <i>Jem</i>-related confessions:<br /><br />1. I had a Jerrica Benton/Jem doll, complete with light-up Synergy star earrings and reversible fringed belt.<br /><br />2. Obviously, I was a devotee of the titular TV show. I vaguely remember the theme song...the (truly outrageous) eye makeup...and Jem's purple-haired boyfriend, Rio. (Sidebar: <i>Jem</i> is available to stream on Netflix. I MAYBE watched the pilot immediately after finishing this book. It was...really <i>pink</i>, but the songs were pretty rad).<br /><br />3. I remember my friends and I saving up our pencil shavings so that we could perform our version of the theme song in the schoolyard during recess, spinning under showers of pencil-shaving confetti. And a similar reenactment in my bedroom (sans pencil shavings) with my cousins, holding our Jem dolls aloft (my cousin, Sara, had Pizazz!) twirling, and singing.<br /><br />4. Fast-forward a few years to a recent comic book store visit, to a male customer announcing to everyone within earshot that he NEEDED the latest issue of <i>Jem</i>. I turned to look at him, convinced he was mocking the book; that he was probably one of those guys I had read about, the ones that, like, aren't down with women in the comic book industry. But, to my surprise, he was smiling. He was holding two issues of <i>Jem</i>, excitedly rhapsodizing about its greatness. (See, this is where the whole changing-my-way-of-thinking thing comes in). Needless to say I was intrigued.<br /><br />Jem (the comic) does "stay true" to the TV show (like, as true as you want to stay to a 1980s cartoon). The women in this comic go after what they want. They are flawed, they question themselves, they have strong female friendships, they are confident. They are very real. It was nice to see that the comic has shed the lithe Barbie-type bodies of the TV show. <br /><br />I kinda wish that Jerrica didn't have to transform into the, like, seven-foot-tall glamazon Jem to have the confidence to perform in front of an audience (I KNOW, I KNOW, IT IS LIKE THE ENTIRE PREMISE OF THE JEM FRANCHISE, BUT STILL), but maybe this is something the comic book will be able to explore a bit more. The art is vibrant and wonderful and is especially effective in the two-page spreads featuring performances of The Holograms or The Misfits. I am excited to see where this is going to go.<br /></span>
  <a data-text-id="3613242536276966525" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">


<tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1484833406">
  <td colspan="2">
    <div class="updateActionLinks">
        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1484833406" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1484833406&amp;resource_type=Review&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F27797730-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">flag</a>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1403378386" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1403378386" />
    <a title="Kirsty" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2795099-kirsty"><img alt="Kirsty" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466429577p2/2795099.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1403378386?book_show_action=true">Sep 28, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Kirsty" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Kirsty" href="/user/show/2795099-kirsty">Kirsty</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2795099-kirsty?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2795099-kirsty?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2795099-kirsty?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1403378386" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer9683246902972539875">I received a copy of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in return for an honest review.<br /><br />Apparently this was a show in the late 1980's however, I never saw it myself. I picked up this comic because it looked a cute light read. This series is about an all girl band whose lead singer gets too nervous to perform and so the band find a new way to get a lead singer.<br /><br />The characters in this are so diverse and that was something I definitely wasn't expecting. As I have already stated I thought I wa</span>
  <span id="freeText9683246902972539875" style="display:none">I received a copy of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in return for an honest review.<br /><br />Apparently this was a show in the late 1980's however, I never saw it myself. I picked up this comic because it looked a cute light read. This series is about an all girl band whose lead singer gets too nervous to perform and so the band find a new way to get a lead singer.<br /><br />The characters in this are so diverse and that was something I definitely wasn't expecting. As I have already stated I thought I was picking up a cute and fluffy read, I didn't expect important themes and such diversity. All the characters felt well fleshed out, although I wanted to know more but I expect that will come in future volumes. <br /><br />The plot was engrossing and entertaining and had me desperately wanting more. I can't wait to find out where things go from here and I was surprised that I found this comic collection so suspenseful. <br /><br />Finally, the art was absolutely stunning, pink is my favourite colour anyway so I was always going to enjoy the art with pink being used heavily throughout. I just thought everything looked so well polished off and the attention to detail on the outfits and hair styles worked out wonderfully.<br /><br />I highly recommend you pick up this series if you think the subject matter and art may be interesting to you. I for one loved this volume a lot more than I expected and I can't wait to pick up future volumes and read more.</span>
  <a data-text-id="9683246902972539875" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

    <a title="Kristina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9176531-kristina"><img alt="Kristina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1529312987p2/9176531.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1631554009?book_show_action=true">May 07, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Kristina" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Kristina" href="/user/show/9176531-kristina">Kristina</a>

<div id="review_1391430114" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1391430114" />
    <a title="Ana" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20947781-ana"><img alt="Ana" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441679724p2/20947781.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1391430114?book_show_action=true">Sep 13, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Ana" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Ana" href="/user/show/20947781-ana">Ana</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>

          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>
           <span class="uitext reviewText">EVERYONE PLEASE GIVE IT A SHOT</span></div>




          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=2015">2015</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=comics-graphic-novels">comics-graphic-novels</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=contemporary">contemporary</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=humor">humor</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=romance">romance</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=music">music</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20947781-ana?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1391430114" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer9052278395864615989"><b>I received this copy in exchange of an honest review, for so, none of my feelings were affected or biased by the author or publisher.</b><br /><br /><b>Update: 11/14/2015</b><br /><br /><a href="http://thegreenbookshelves.blogspot.com/2015/11/the-good-ol-times-are-back.html" rel="nofollow">If you'd like to read this review on my blog.</a><br /><br /><b>Rating: 3.5/5 stars.</b><br /><br /><i>Jem and the Holograms is a story of dreams, finding your true self and having fun along the way! We meet our four heroins, who are just about to make their dreams of becoming super stars true, if only Jerrica could bring herself to sing. But just as they were loosing hope, they find</i></span>
  <span id="freeText9052278395864615989" style="display:none"><b>I received this copy in exchange of an honest review, for so, none of my feelings were affected or biased by the author or publisher.</b><br /><br /><b>Update: 11/14/2015</b><br /><br /><a href="http://thegreenbookshelves.blogspot.com/2015/11/the-good-ol-times-are-back.html" rel="nofollow">If you'd like to read this review on my blog.</a><br /><br /><b>Rating: 3.5/5 stars.</b><br /><br /><i>Jem and the Holograms is a story of dreams, finding your true self and having fun along the way! We meet our four heroins, who are just about to make their dreams of becoming super stars true, if only Jerrica could bring herself to sing. But just as they were loosing hope, they find a strange machine, that might help them in unexpected ways.</i><br /><br />Man, this book was so much fun!<br /><br />Ok, confesion time has arrived...<s>I've never seen the TV show this is based on and only found out about it thanks to this!..</s><br /><br />I know, most people loved this show when little and think that this graphic novel is such a waste of times because the show was so much better and this isn't adding anything new... but I'm new to this, so this is my side of the story.<br /><br />First of all, the illustrations were <i>soooo prettyyyy</i> and colorful! This is the brightest palete of colors I've seen in a graphic novel. And I loved it. All the hair and costumes and colors and music tunes got me completely hooked and hallucinating!<br /><br />The story itself was really light, nothing deep, really fun things happening all around. I really didn't even bother to see the not so well done things happening around (except the "ok cool, a machine that it's better than the world, all good" thing) because the story was really fun and I couldn't take it too seriously.<br /><br />I loved that it had so much diversity in such a simple way. And that there literally was no conflict about any of it.<br /><br />This novel felt like a 90's show. And I know it's kind of dumb to point that out, but it really felt like those old shows I used to watch when I was little. Except that social media was all over the place.<br /><br />Anyway, I really enjoyed this novel, really recommend, read it, even if you watched the TV show when little. Good all the same.<br /><br /><b>Initial Reaction</b><br /><br />THAT WAS SO FUN! I WANT MORE! I absolutely adore this story, it's so funny and cute, and the art style has me seeing stars! I want to read the reeeeeest...<br /><br />Proper review to come.</span>
  <a data-text-id="9052278395864615989" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1568177921" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1568177921" />
    <a title="Courtney" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10688316-courtney"><img alt="Courtney" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1350261435p2/10688316.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1568177921?book_show_action=true">Mar 03, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Courtney" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Courtney" href="/user/show/10688316-courtney">Courtney</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>


          <div>
    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Courtney by: </span>
      Val
  </div>



          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=at-work">at-work</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=comics">comics</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=diverse-cast">diverse-cast</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=drama">drama</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=family">family</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=gay-bi-trans-stuff">gay-bi-trans-stuff</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=graphic-novels">graphic-novels</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=love-and-romance">love-and-romance</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=music">music</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10688316-courtney?shelf=read-for-work">read-for-work</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1568177921" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer10686636757958494530">This is a re-make of the old TV cartoon series Jem &amp; the Holograms (apparently I was a fan, but I have no memory of the actual show), updated for the new millenium.<br /><br />I thought this was a pretty good adaptation from what little I know of the show. Four sisters have formed a band and are planning to enter a major competition for a chance to win a record deal. Unfortunately, their lead singer Jerrica is terrified of performing in front of people. Normally this would be a short story about believi</span>
  <span id="freeText10686636757958494530" style="display:none">This is a re-make of the old TV cartoon series Jem &amp; the Holograms (apparently I was a fan, but I have no memory of the actual show), updated for the new millenium.<br /><br />I thought this was a pretty good adaptation from what little I know of the show. Four sisters have formed a band and are planning to enter a major competition for a chance to win a record deal. Unfortunately, their lead singer Jerrica is terrified of performing in front of people. Normally this would be a short story about believing in ones-self, and finding the confidence to perform, but that wouldn't sell as many books, so instead she discovers a holographic program left to the sisters by their father that can create an entirely new identity for her, giving her the courage to perform.<br /><br />I didn't see any 'cons', but it might not be as suitable for smaller kids (though they probably wouldn't be as interested anyway). There's some mild-ish language, but it was more rude than actual swearing (hell, damn, omigod were about the worst of it). <br />There was some 'PDA' stuff, but nothing further than a couple of kisses (in this volume, anyway). Homophobes might have a problem since it's mostly between two girls (the het couple's relationships haven't developed that far yet), but it's pretty innocent. Some cuddling. <br />There is a little violence - a food fight on the light side, but one character attempts to injure the main group by having some heavy metal catwalks or light-beams or something fall on them, causing some injuries.<br /><br />There's a lot more on the positive side going on, that would make this worth reading. <br />The cast here seems to be quite diverse -granted it's still early in the series, so readers will have to see if they keep up the standard of if the creators are just marking off a check-list to cover their bases, but it seems pretty good so far. <br />Some of the characters have odd skin-tones to start with (Jem/Jerrica is <i>pink</i> pink, for instance, not just peach-ish, and Kimberly is corpse-white), but there are characters who are clearly black, I think one of the sisters is of Asian descent, and the main love interest, Rio, I think is hispanic (his skin tone is darker, and his last name is apparently Portugese/Spanish). It's not the largely-white cast of the original series. <br />Plus, there's the afore-mentioned lesbian couple, and het couples mentioned earlier. <br />The artists created variety of body-types, for the characters as well - there's no 'Barbie doll' figure that standard for everyone here. Some of the characters are thin, some on the heavier side, some are curvy, some are flat... Definitely a more realistic and representative approach than the old cartoon, or even most of the media you see today. <br /><br />Plot-wise it's not as strong, but it's still pretty early on. It's mostly just a slice-of-life comic, with one half centring around the girls relationships with each other, and the significant others they pick up along the way, and the other half of the focus being their journey to stardom and rivalry with the Misfits (the more punki-sh band who seem to take the Hologram's successes as some kind of personal insult). It's still setting up a lot at this point, so it's hard to say if the plot will get stronger later on.<br /><br />Over-all it's a decent comic, and I think I'd be interested in checking out future volumes, myself.<br /><br />~*~*~*~*~*~*~<br /><br />Needed to read this for work - one of the supervisors wanted it checked for inappropriate content (publisher didn't give an age-rating on the book) before showing it to the teachers for our yearly book-order. It looks like a pretty good contender, honestly, as there's not much in it that most people would object to - I found there was a lot more going on in it's favour, honestly. </span>
  <a data-text-id="10686636757958494530" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1568177921'><a id="like_count_review_1568177921" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1568177921?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">4 likes</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F27797730-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">Like</a></span>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1381679718" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1381679718" />
    <a title="Keith" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/31002-keith"><img alt="Keith" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471996653p2/31002.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1381679718?book_show_action=true">Sep 03, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Keith" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Keith" href="/user/show/31002-keith">Keith</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1381679718" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16281334990563640301">I've been pretty pumped about this title for awhile. As an 80's kid (when themed action figure toylines were in their heyday), I was always curious about any toys aimed at girls that seemed to have a storyline past buying clothes. Of course I couldn't <i>buy</i> any of these toys and save face with my friends, but from afar there were a few that seemed pretty right-on.<br /><br />Of these, Jem sent up the most fireworks in my little-boy brain. That amazing rotoscoped animation on the cartoon, the rock band premise</span>
  <span id="freeText16281334990563640301" style="display:none">I've been pretty pumped about this title for awhile. As an 80's kid (when themed action figure toylines were in their heyday), I was always curious about any toys aimed at girls that seemed to have a storyline past buying clothes. Of course I couldn't <i>buy</i> any of these toys and save face with my friends, but from afar there were a few that seemed pretty right-on.<br /><br />Of these, Jem sent up the most fireworks in my little-boy brain. That amazing rotoscoped animation on the cartoon, the rock band premise (complete with evil band rivalries!), the multicolored hair and keytars -- plus those songs kind of kicked ass for a kid whose knowledge of modern music began and ended with the California Raisins.<br /><br />So the power of nostalgia gave me pretty high hopes for this comic. On top of that, I think Jem occupies a pretty weird niche in the world of media aimed at young girls. Of course the concept plays into a lot of gender tropes that have since become somewhat problematic -- mainly the focus on fashion and being 'pretty,' but also the ridiculous color palette itself (PINK! PURPLE! PINK! BLUE! PINK!). I mean, yeah.<br /><br />But at the same time, Jem is just about as grrl power as kid's stuff gets (with the exception of maybe She-Ra -- but then again, Jem didn't have a companion line of 'boy toys' to cross-market with). Jem is really about kicking ass and taking over the world with all your girlfriends. The only boy in the whole story basically exists to be cute and keep things organized. Plus, have you WATCHED that old Jem cartoon? By no means do the characters just sit around and talk about clothes. Hell, they barely have time to write new songs -- most of the time they're fighting the Misfits, playing gigs on no sleep, saving kids from homelessness and otherwise BEING FUCKING AWESOME.<br /><br />I'm sorry you guys. But I'm telling you: Jem is fucking cool.<br /><br />Anyway, the Jem comic. A lot to live up to. The Jem movie that came out this year demonstrated how to do everything totally wrong, and I think Jem-nerds agree that the comic is a welcome antidote. It's totally modern, with interesting characters who each have fully-rendered personalities and different drives. The aesthetic is a mix of 80's eyegasms and modern tech. The women have a wide range of normal bodies (seriously, I am serious here) and believable personalities, and the main romance in the book is between two girls without anyone commenting on it once. There's a lot of cool, thoughtful stuff in here.<br /><br />Is the comic as balls-out awesome as the 80's incarnation? No. While its political awareness is through the roof, the storytelling is a little light -- in six issues, about as much happens as in about ten minutes of the original cartoon. Instead of drama, there are a lot of loooong talking head scenes. It's basically borrowing all the slow pathos of romance manga, without remembering that Jem is also about Action! Drama! Running from explosions! <br /><br />In place of all that, this book has one sort of hardcore food fight. No explosions. And this made me a little sad.<br /><br />I think Jem does everything that it's trying to do very, very well. I just hope that in the future it tries to do a little more. You've got real-feeling female characters who have real feelings, and they're dating in healthy ways! And that's rad! Now let's kick some ass!</span>
  <a data-text-id="16281334990563640301" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1384302811" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1384302811" />
    <a title="Mike" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1776702-mike"><img alt="Mike" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474662823p2/1776702.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1384302811?book_show_action=true">Sep 24, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Mike" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Mike" href="/user/show/1776702-mike">Mike</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1776702-mike?shelf=found-via-goodreads">found-via-goodreads</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1776702-mike?shelf=fun">fun</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1776702-mike?shelf=gateway-comics">gateway-comics</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1384302811" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16213105350301646969">I really am a grown man, mortgage marriage and (usually) employment. (Plenty of footage that led to my last firing, some still under court seal.)<br><br>So why the hell would I be reading a comic about an 80's pre-teen-girls-marketed cartoon?<br><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/5172893-sesana" rel="nofollow">Sesana</a> of course. One of the more illustrious <a href="https://shallowreaders.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">Shallow Comics Readers</a>, when Sesana gets this excited about something you best pay attention son.<br><br>Plus they're written by Kelly Thompson who just got a gig writing Hawkeye (starring Kate Bishop) for Marvel. Big step, got</span>
  <span id="freeText16213105350301646969" style="display:none">I really am a grown man, mortgage marriage and (usually) employment. (Plenty of footage that led to my last firing, some still under court seal.)<br><br>So why the hell would I be reading a comic about an 80's pre-teen-girls-marketed cartoon?<br><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/5172893-sesana" rel="nofollow">Sesana</a> of course. One of the more illustrious <a href="https://shallowreaders.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">Shallow Comics Readers</a>, when Sesana gets this excited about something you best pay attention son.<br><br>Plus they're written by Kelly Thompson who just got a gig writing Hawkeye (starring Kate Bishop) for Marvel. Big step, got my attention, so I need to read this...FOR RESEARCH.<br><br>So: the origin story. Jerrica can't sing in front of people, the band (of sisters) want to enter the contest tomorrow, and Jerrica stumbles on this at home:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638223._SY540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And with dad's magic earrings (OK, holographic projectors, needing no power source or amplification - so, magic), Jerrica can put on a Jem "costume":<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638224._SY540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The art in the singing sequences is pretty rad:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638225._SY540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The plots are a bit...sweet and low-key. Their rival band is a bit...mean?<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638226._SX540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638227._SX540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The local community Center needs a fundraising boost?<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638228._SX540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Then again, the side plots are cool romantic:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638229._SX540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And was that a My Little Pony cameo?<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638230._SY540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I'm fascinated by this book. The insane hair, the space-age makeup, the clothes - this is girlie-porn isn't it?<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638231._SX540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The most amazing thing though? The cover by Amanda Conner doesn't have one gratuitous ass or cleavage shot!<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474748710i/20638232._SY540_.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>[It's a Christmas miracle!]<br><br>This is a lighthearted book, with characters I still somehow come to care about. I can't believe a 46-year-old dude is saying this, but I'm gonna read the next one.</span>
  <a data-text-id="16213105350301646969" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1621380590" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1621380590" />
    <a title="Kyle" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7773195-kyle"><img alt="Kyle" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1491580760p2/7773195.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1621380590?book_show_action=true">Apr 26, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Kyle" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Kyle" href="/user/show/7773195-kyle">Kyle</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7773195-kyle?shelf=graphic-novels-comic-books">graphic-novels-comic-books</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1621380590" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4215193072755944094">As a little, spirited boy in the '80's, I used to sprint home from public school to watch Jem and the Holograms, He Man, She-Ra and Transformers. It's totally not a surprise that I turned out the way that I did, right?<br /><br />It also shouldn't have been a surprise to me that, as a fully-grown, spirited man-nerd, that I am clearly not the intended audience for this comic book. I was kinda hoping that there would be a bit more wink-wink, tongue-in-cheek material for the fans of yesteryear, but for the mos</span>
  <span id="freeText4215193072755944094" style="display:none">As a little, spirited boy in the '80's, I used to sprint home from public school to watch Jem and the Holograms, He Man, She-Ra and Transformers. It's totally not a surprise that I turned out the way that I did, right?<br /><br />It also shouldn't have been a surprise to me that, as a fully-grown, spirited man-nerd, that I am clearly not the intended audience for this comic book. I was kinda hoping that there would be a bit more wink-wink, tongue-in-cheek material for the fans of yesteryear, but for the most part, this is a true reboot for Jem, bringing her to a new and current young, feminine audience.<br /><br />I admire how this series chooses to tackle issues that, back in the '80's would have been taboo and nearly impossible to talk about with a youth audience. Most inspiring to me is the portrayal of Kimber and Stormer's romance. It is treated with absolute normalcy, even given the status of main romantic subplot over Jerrica and Rio's. It is a welcome creative choice that seems in bold defiance to what other, larger comic book companies claim is too difficult to publish in their pages. Take note Marvel and DC-- this is how you do it!<br /><br />The writing is a little "lite", but the artwork is pretty darn slick and stylized, with bright, colourful illustrations that depict a diverse cast of characters by their body types, race, gender.... All of these politically complex traits seem so effortlessly depicted in Jem and the Holograms, that, as an adult reader, you really start to wonder, "What is wrong with other mainstream publishers?" Clearly diversity can be done, and done well. So do it, already!<br /><br />While I didn't find myself wrapped-up in the plot, and I wouldn't consider this book to be a page-turner, I certainly would consider it to be a trailblazer. It deserves a lot of recognition for its approach to inclusiveness and positivity. Books like this and Lumberjanes are the future of comics, and I, for one, embrace and love it.<br /><br />4/5</span>
  <a data-text-id="4215193072755944094" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1390741822" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1390741822" />
    <a title="Lucy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19649406-lucy"><img alt="Lucy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1537271794p2/19649406.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1390741822?book_show_action=true">Sep 13, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Lucy" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Lucy" href="/user/show/19649406-lucy">Lucy</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=ebooks">ebooks</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=lgbtqiap-lesbian">lgbtqiap-lesbian</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=protagonists-of-colour">protagonists-of-colour</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=2015">2015</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=comics-as-trade-paperbacks">comics-as-trade-paperbacks</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19649406-lucy?shelf=borrowed-or-had-arc-but-now-own">borrowed-or-had-arc-but-now-own</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1390741822" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11000541511377976754">I recieved a copy of this from the publisher via Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.<br /><br />I never watched Jem and the Holograms as a kid, being born in 1993 and with new pop culture staples (Rugrats, Wild Thornberries and Captain Planet, anyone?) to occupy my formative years, so I went into this with no expectations. But I think that even if I had, they would have been exceeded. This graphic novel is a visual feast. The art is bright and appealing, and everyone's character designs are so, so g</span>
  <span id="freeText11000541511377976754" style="display:none">I recieved a copy of this from the publisher via Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.<br /><br />I never watched Jem and the Holograms as a kid, being born in 1993 and with new pop culture staples (Rugrats, Wild Thornberries and Captain Planet, anyone?) to occupy my formative years, so I went into this with no expectations. But I think that even if I had, they would have been exceeded. This graphic novel is a visual feast. The art is bright and appealing, and everyone's character designs are so, so gorgeous. This is definitely a series I want to own.<br /><br />It's about four sisters who have a band named Jem and the Holograms, but the lead singer Jerrica (nicknamed Jem, obvs) has a severe case of stage fright, so the future for them looks bleak. When the girls discover that their late father created a program called Synergy capable of throwing holograms, everything changes. Jerrica can now cover herself in a hologram and perform without fear. Thus unencumbered, the girls enter a band competition against a band named The Misfits, a super-popular girl group with a lead singer with some serious ego problems. The four sisters encounter problems along the way, but they stick together and find a way to overcome them, even when all seems lost. It was so, so nice to see everyone be so supportive of each other.<br /><br />This series is also an exercise in diversity that everyone should pay attention to. Racial diversity. Body-type diversity. Two lesbian characters (who I ship infinitely!!! and it's also CANON omfg wow). It's glorious. I love it. I can't wait to read the next volume and be delighted all over again.<br /><br />5/5 stars.</span>
  <a data-text-id="11000541511377976754" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1497067296" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1497067296" />
    <a title="Marina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7785364-marina"><img alt="Marina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475803573p2/7785364.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1497067296?book_show_action=true">Jan 05, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Marina" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Marina" href="/user/show/7785364-marina">Marina</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=dragoonthechallenge">dragoonthechallenge</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=female-author">female-author</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=female-protag">female-protag</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=lgbtqia">lgbtqia</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=comics">comics</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7785364-marina?shelf=feminism">feminism</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1497067296" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16795695648414104499">This book is a <i>delight</i>!!! <br /><br />I wasn't familiar with the cartoon other than knowing it existed and that it was very 80s, so coming to this book I didn't really know what to expect. However, it had been highly recommended by a reviewer whose opinions I trust and they were not wrong, I loved it. <br /><br />From the very start you know what you'll be getting from this book, it's colorful, the art is fantastic, the story is a bit silly, but full of heart, and definitely something you could see on your tv with no p</span>
  <span id="freeText16795695648414104499" style="display:none">This book is a <i>delight</i>!!! <br /><br />I wasn't familiar with the cartoon other than knowing it existed and that it was very 80s, so coming to this book I didn't really know what to expect. However, it had been highly recommended by a reviewer whose opinions I trust and they were not wrong, I loved it. <br /><br />From the very start you know what you'll be getting from this book, it's colorful, the art is fantastic, the story is a bit silly, but full of heart, and definitely something you could see on your tv with no problem. It reminded me, in the best way possible, of Totally Spies, which is one of my favorite cartoons ever.<br /><br />This is a book that gives me hope. It's unapologetic about how bright and glam it is, with so much pink, glitter and incredible hairstyles. And it's also full of diversity, queer girls kissing and falling in love (!!!) and bodies of all types and colors everywhere. It's refreshing and everything you need when you want to feel happy and comforted.<br /><br />Give it a chance, the essence of what Jem and The Holograms represented to an entire generation is very much still there. You won't regret it, I promise.<br /><br />ps: I am now picturing kylo ren as pizzazz because that would be the best, god bless the pissbabies of the world<br /><br />pps: I MEAN IT, READ IT, IT'S SO MUCH FUN I'M IN LOVE AND NEED PPL TO COSPLAY THIS SHIT W/ ME (or at least like my instagram pics when i eventually decide to live my life in full jem and the hol. inspired makeup)</span>
  <a data-text-id="16795695648414104499" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1497067296'><a id="like_count_review_1497067296" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1497067296?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">3 likes</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F27797730-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">Like</a></span>

    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1236830103" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1236830103" />
    <a title="Solace Winter" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4103295-solace-winter"><img alt="Solace Winter" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1323321843p2/4103295.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1236830103?book_show_action=true">Mar 25, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Solace Winter" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Solace Winter" href="/user/show/4103295-solace-winter">Solace Winter</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Comic " href="/book/show/25216223-jem-and-the-holograms-1">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1236830103" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer3227341130358132751">I'm not 100% sure how I feel about the art style in this comic yet. Yes, it's obviously very different than it was in the original cartoon/comics/toyline, but that's not really the issue. The designs are just different than what I'm used to. Also, Aja is chubby in this, which I think is great that they are embracing all body types, but at the end of it you see a preview cover of the next comic. The Asian girl from The Misfits (who I do not remember the name of off the top of my head right now) i</span>
  <span id="freeText3227341130358132751" style="display:none">I'm not 100% sure how I feel about the art style in this comic yet. Yes, it's obviously very different than it was in the original cartoon/comics/toyline, but that's not really the issue. The designs are just different than what I'm used to. Also, Aja is chubby in this, which I think is great that they are embracing all body types, but at the end of it you see a preview cover of the next comic. The Asian girl from The Misfits (who I do not remember the name of off the top of my head right now) is also chubby. Is this reverse stereo-typing? Embrace different body types, but don't then make a stereotype of the art.<br /><br />Art aside, the story is good. It's definitely a different telling of the story, and I'm fine with that. This is less about doing it to save an orphanage so much as this is what Kimber, the youngest, has dreamed of wanting all of her life. Kimber was always my favorite, and I think it will be the same going forward here. Kimber is actually given the most character in this first issue, more than Jerrica as Jerrica is just kind of mousy and afraid. Shana and Aja shine as well, but not as bright, though I'm sure we'll see more of them. The one thing the old Jem always had was story for all of the characters, and I hope, and think, that will carry on to this one. </span>
  <a data-text-id="3227341130358132751" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1460877424" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer13909886658675101788">So well done! Thompson and Campbell take the spirit of the original tv show and update it just enough to not seem inauthentic or forced. One of the first comics were we see character design that is inclusive, feminist and features different types of body shapes. Love the queer elements they've infused here. And the artwork is outstanding - unique layouts, bold colors that pop off the page and fantastic character moments. It's unfortunate the recent movie reboot got it so wrong, because this comi</span>
  <span id="freeText13909886658675101788" style="display:none">So well done! Thompson and Campbell take the spirit of the original tv show and update it just enough to not seem inauthentic or forced. One of the first comics were we see character design that is inclusive, feminist and features different types of body shapes. Love the queer elements they've infused here. And the artwork is outstanding - unique layouts, bold colors that pop off the page and fantastic character moments. It's unfortunate the recent movie reboot got it so wrong, because this comic book series gets it so right.</span>
  <a data-text-id="13909886658675101788" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

  <span id="freeText32382736075539125" style="display:none">The art is phenomenal. <div id="review_1430219647" class="review nosyndicate" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1430219647" />
    <a title="Lina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4014494-lina"><img alt="Lina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1313620406p2/4014494.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1430219647?book_show_action=true">Oct 31, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
