    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1430219647" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer16908554159471740397">I LOVE JEM SO MUCH! The cartoon was pure 80's joy about a woman named Jerrica Benton and her three sisters who after finding a machine called Synergy, start a band. <br /><br />Now I know there was a horrible, bad, no good film with a similar title out, just ignore that. Read this instead. It has: great racial diversity with different complexions and not just tans, adorable lesbians, adorable plus sized lesbians, and sisterhood!<br /><br />Please support this awesome comic, you will not regret it!</span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_1656790787" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1656790787" />
    <a title="Ana Rînceanu" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/28781546-ana-r-nceanu"><img alt="Ana Rînceanu" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450253963p2/28781546.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1656790787?book_show_action=true">Jun 02, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Ana Rînceanu" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Ana Rînceanu" href="/user/show/28781546-ana-r-nceanu">Ana Rînceanu</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=comics">comics</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=lgbtqia">lgbtqia</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=science-fiction">science-fiction</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=21st-century">21st-century</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=north-american-literature">north-american-literature</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28781546-ana-r-nceanu?shelf=united-states-literature">united-states-literature</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1656790787" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4098626285035454382">If you're tired of superheroes and want something in the vein of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/21876672.Lumberjanes__1" title="Lumberjanes #1 by Noelle Stevenson" rel="nofollow">Lumberjanes #1</a> but with teen rockstars, I highly recommend this comic. You'll love all the characters and the art is gorgeous.</span>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

<div id="review_1574648353" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1574648353" />
    <a title="Amy!" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1938435-amy"><img alt="Amy!" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1433463417p2/1938435.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1574648353?book_show_action=true">Mar 09, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Amy!" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Amy!" href="/user/show/1938435-amy">Amy!</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="really liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

              >

<span id="freeTextContainer4398854766190937285">This is SO FUN. I love all the bubblegum and cotton candy colors of the book, and the sisters' relationships with each other, and the diversity of the characters, and that the main love interest angst is between two girls and literally no one cares that they're both girls, only that they're in rival bands, and it was just a delight. </span>

          </span>
        </div>

<div id="review_2398831013" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2398831013" />
    <a title="Murphy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/74077043-murphy"><img alt="Murphy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1517097169p2/74077043.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/2398831013?book_show_action=true">Jun 02, 2018</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Murphy" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Murphy" href="/user/show/74077043-murphy">Murphy</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="liked it"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>






          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/74077043-murphy?shelf=idw-publishing">idw-publishing</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/74077043-murphy?shelf=three-stars">three-stars</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer2398831013" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11543552590608781843">I wasn't sure if I would enjoy this series since I'd never see the original cartoon and barely have any understanding of its plot, but luckily I found it to be sweet, entertaining and thoroughly creative. <br /><br />Working on a comic with a heavy focus on music leads to the obvious challenge of how to present melodies without an audio component, and I think the creative team did an excellent job crafting lyrics and artwork together to give readers an idea of how the songs sounded.<br /><br />The most meaningful part</span>
  <span id="freeText11543552590608781843" style="display:none">I wasn't sure if I would enjoy this series since I'd never see the original cartoon and barely have any understanding of its plot, but luckily I found it to be sweet, entertaining and thoroughly creative. <br /><br />Working on a comic with a heavy focus on music leads to the obvious challenge of how to present melodies without an audio component, and I think the creative team did an excellent job crafting lyrics and artwork together to give readers an idea of how the songs sounded.<br /><br />The most meaningful part of each issue in my opinion was the dynamic between the sisters, I have two younger sisters and growing up with close siblings involves frustration and sacrifice, but most of all love and alliance, which were all caringly displayed between these characters. <br /><br />I also liked how sapphic attraction was shown in a casual and carefree manner, it's important for LGBT readers of any age to find media that truly accepts and empowers us, without always focusing on the bigotry we face. <br /><br />Overall these comics were engaging and refreshing, and I feel that many different people could probably find something either in the story or the art that appeals to them. I'm glad I decided to give them a try.<br /><br /></span>
  <a data-text-id="11543552590608781843" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >
    <div class="section">


<div id="review_1727765907" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1727765907" />
    <a title="Lacey Louwagie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33816-lacey-louwagie"><img alt="Lacey Louwagie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1330366315p2/33816.jpg" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1727765907?book_show_action=true">Aug 13, 2016</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Lacey Louwagie" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Lacey Louwagie" href="/user/show/33816-lacey-louwagie">Lacey Louwagie</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was amazing"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Comic " href="/book/show/25216223-jem-and-the-holograms-1">review of another edition</a>





          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">
            Shelves:
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=2016-read-harder-challenge">2016-read-harder-challenge</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=faves">faves</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=graphicnovels">graphicnovels</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=lgbtqi">lgbtqi</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=magical-realism">magical-realism</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=retelling">retelling</a>,
              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33816-lacey-louwagie?shelf=sciencefiction">sciencefiction</a>
          </div>
    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
                  <em>
                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,
                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1727765907&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>
                  </em>
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1727765907" class="readable"
                    style="display:none"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer9131077267772380143">Book Riot Read Harder Challenge Item: A non-superhero comic that debuted in the last 3 years<br /><br />I am not afraid to admit that nostalgia may have inflated my rating.<br /><br />However, it's not as if I'd fawn over any Jem-related property. My reaction to the movie reboot was <a href="http://laceylouwagie.com/2015/10/28/retelling-movie-review-what-really-ruined-the-new-jem-movie/" rel="nofollow">far from positive</a>.<br /><br />This reimagining of the JEM canon works because it strikes the perfect balance between nostalgia and modern sensibilities. Although the character designs have been updated, their personalities have remained intact while re</span>
  <span id="freeText9131077267772380143" style="display:none">Book Riot Read Harder Challenge Item: A non-superhero comic that debuted in the last 3 years<br /><br />I am not afraid to admit that nostalgia may have inflated my rating.<br /><br />However, it's not as if I'd fawn over any Jem-related property. My reaction to the movie reboot was <a href="http://laceylouwagie.com/2015/10/28/retelling-movie-review-what-really-ruined-the-new-jem-movie/" rel="nofollow">far from positive</a>.<br /><br />This reimagining of the JEM canon works because it strikes the perfect balance between nostalgia and modern sensibilities. Although the character designs have been updated, their personalities have remained intact while receiving greater depth; story threads that were only subtexts in the original series are brought out into the open here. Also, I have nothing but good to say about the update to the character designs -- whereas all the female characters in the original essentially shared the exact same fashion-plate body, in this incarnation we see body diversity along with the ethnic diversity that the show always managed to pull off. Jerrica and the gang come off as somewhat "younger" than they do in the original, but I think that is partially because the original was aimed at kids, where an adult is just an adult, whereas this is aimed at older readers who know how rare it is for someone to be CEO of their own record label at age 23.<br /><br />This does make me wonder how new readers would treat the more fantastical elements of this story, couched as they are in a more realistic setting without a lot of explanation about how they work. But perplexing newcomers is a price I am willing to pay to keep some of the iconic story elements -- ahem, SYNERGY -- from the original intact. <br /><br />Also, there are some things that make MORE sense in this incarnation. We're never really given an upfront reason for the creation of JEM in the original -- why did Jerrica change her identity while everyone else remained themselves? As the original series goes on the viewer starts to perceive that Jerrica needs her alter-ego to "cut loose," but this is handled in a more upfront manner in the comic: Jerrica, while a talented musician and songwriter, has debilitating stage fright and can only perform when hiding behind the persona of JEM.<br /><br />And yeah, there are definitely some cheesy moments that in most cases would make me roll my eyes -- but when they appear I ask myself, "Would this sort of thing have happened on the cartoon?" When I realize the answer is yes, I just have to sort of shake my head and smile indulgently. And I love all the little details here, especially when it comes to Pizazz. She comes across as a bit more "mean girl" and a bit less "loose cannon" than in the cartoon, but there are these sweet "softening" touches that just make you want to know more about who she REALLY is -- who are the science fiction action figures next to her bed? She's also been given a Siamese cat which seems a perfect fit (Siamese are known for being one of the most "prickly" and temperamental breeds), and in the final frame, just the hint of a tear in her eye as she rants about Jem and the Holograms stealing the spotlight.<br /><br />The nascent love stories, both between Kimber and Stormer and Jerrica and Rio are sweet, although I'm worried that Rio might discover the dual identity too early on in the series. I will be disappointed if the comic ends up matching the movie in that regard, both because Jerrica's secret identity provided such an ongoing sense of tension in the original (where Rio never DID find out) AND because dudes with secret identities are allowed to hold onto them (and the power it gives them) for decades against all odds. I hope the new writers will give Jem the same courtesy; in so many other ways they've kept this "true" to the things that made the Jem series so beloved.<br /><br />I've already ordered the next two volumes. I hardly ever purchase books new, but when it comes to series like this that are so close to my heart, I just want to keep throwing money at them. </span>
  <a data-text-id="9131077267772380143" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1727765907'><a id="like_count_review_1727765907" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1727765907?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">2 likes</span></a>&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/new?remember=true&amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F27797730-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">Like</a></span>

    <a title="Kathryn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3395334-kathryn"><img alt="Kathryn" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_50x66-6a03a5c12233c941481992b82eea8d23.png" /></a>

  <div class="left bodycol">
    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">
        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" href="/review/show/1442141226?book_show_action=true">Nov 13, 2015</a>

      <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a title="Kathryn" class="user" itemprop="url" name="Kathryn" href="/user/show/3395334-kathryn">Kathryn</a>
      </span>

        rated it
        <span class=" staticStars" title="it was ok"><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>

          <span class="greyText">&nbsp;&middot;&nbsp;</span>
          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781631403958" href="/book/show/26031312-jem-and-the-holograms-vol-1">review of another edition</a>





    </div>


        <div class="reviewText stacked">
              <span id="reviewTextContainer1442141226" class="readable"
              >

<span id="freeTextContainer11327173800905939261">I tend to read comic books from time to time. Usually of the superhero variety. But nostalgia drew me to this title. And when I saw that it was on sale in a digital format, I simply couldn't resist. I was a bit disappointed, however.<br /><br />The Good:<br />While a bit more cartoony than I'm used to, the art in this book is quite good. It fits the tone of the writing and even enhances it a lot of the time. This is an updated version of Jem and the Holograms. Unlike the disastrous movie, however, it does not com</span>
  <span id="freeText11327173800905939261" style="display:none">I tend to read comic books from time to time. Usually of the superhero variety. But nostalgia drew me to this title. And when I saw that it was on sale in a digital format, I simply couldn't resist. I was a bit disappointed, however.<br /><br />The Good:<br />While a bit more cartoony than I'm used to, the art in this book is quite good. It fits the tone of the writing and even enhances it a lot of the time. This is an updated version of Jem and the Holograms. Unlike the disastrous movie, however, it does not completely lose sight of the original source material. It also incorporates social media, but does so seamlessly and in a way that makes sense. I also greatly appreciate the fact that the writer is trying to give the Holograms personalities and storylines. This is something that I always felt was lacking in the original cartoon.<br /><br />Sadly, there is enough wrong with this incarnation of the beloved 80's cartoon that I can't really give it anything more than a 2-star rating.<br /><br />The Bad<br />The show was called Jem and the Holograms for a reason. JEM... and the Holograms. Jerrica/Jem is supposed to be the star. So why does Kimber get all the attention? It's quite obvious that Kimber is Thompson's favourite character. KIMBER gets bonding time with Syngery. KIMBER is the one who tells us about the late Mrs. Benton. KIMBER is the one whose love life everyone frets over. KIMBER is the assertive one who stands up to Pizzazz and pushes Jerrica to be a star. It's the Kimber show. Similarly, her romantic subplot with Stormer - which is very poorly developed - gets far more panel time than Jerrica's relationship with Rio. Overall, there's just too much focus on Kimber and nowhere near enough on Jerrica.<br /><br />Speaking of Jerrica, what's with the modern incarnations of her? She is probably the blandest character in the book (aside from Shana who literally does nothing other than calm people down). We barely know anything about her. Where's the inner turmoil of being two people at once? Where's the big sister Jerrica who was always watching out for her family and friends? <br /><br />Even when she isn't being Jem, Jerrica is a strong female figure. She is a CEO who also runs a home for young girls. She stands up for herself and is good at making decisions and keeping it all together. Why do both the movie and this book insist on turning Jerrica into an insecure milquetoast who DOESN’T run a successful business? Is the idea of a woman being assertive both on and off the stage too threatening?<br /><br />Another problem I had with the book was that it was unclear whether it was meant for adults or children. There are lots of adult themes in here (i.e. the romances, some of the artwork and lyrics for the Misfits, etc.). But the supposedly adult cast behaves so childishly (a food fight?!) and the stories are too shallow to maintain the interest of an adult for more than a few issues. Who is this book meant for exactly?<br /><br />I LOVE the Jem and the Holograms cartoon and was very excited about this release, but unfortunately can't recommend it to anyone for all of the reasons above.</span>
  <a data-text-id="11327173800905939261" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

          </span>
        </div>


      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">

//<![CDATA[

  function submitShelfLink(unique_id, book_id, shelf_id, shelf_name, submit_form, exclusive) {
    var checkbox_id = 'shelf_name_' + unique_id + '_' + shelf_id;
    var element = document.getElementById(checkbox_id)

    var checked = element.checked
    if (checked && exclusive) {
      // can't uncheck a radio by clicking it!
      return
    }
    if(document.getElementById("savingMessage")){
      Element.show('savingMessage')
    }
    var element_id = 'shelfInDropdownName_' + unique_id + '_' + shelf_id;
    Element.update(element_id, "saving...");
    if (submit_form) {
      Element.hide('shelfDropdown_' + unique_id)
      var form = document.getElementById('addBookForm' + book_id)
      if (form) {
        form.shelf.value = shelf_name
        form.onsubmit()
      }
    }
    else {
      var action = checked ? 'remove' : ''
      element.checked = !element.checked
      new Ajax.Request('/shelf/add_to_shelf', {asynchronous:true, evalScripts:true, onSuccess:function(request){shelfSubmitted(request, book_id, checkbox_id, element_id, unique_id, shelf_name)}, parameters:'book_id=' + book_id + '&name=' + shelf_name + '&a=' + action + '&authenticity_token=' + encodeURIComponent('LNoyQ4iSiazsSNIZZ94y9zfpaQZqY1xYLqk/tFm6psdw/cxrhJ6HgAsA/ucuQWtje3WyDFtVM2WvA1LgzkKgPQ==')})
    }
  }

  function shelfSubmitted(request, book_id, checkbox_id, element_id, unique_id, shelf_name) {
    Element.update('shelfListfalse_' + book_id, request.responseText)
    afterShelfSave(checkbox_id, element_id, unique_id, shelf_name.escapeHTML())
  }

  function refreshGroupBox(group_id, book_id) {
    new Ajax.Updater('addGroupBooks' + book_id + '', '/group/add_book_box', {asynchronous:true, evalScripts:true, onSuccess:function(request){refreshGroupBoxComplete(request, book_id);}, parameters:'id=' + group_id + '&book_id=' + book_id + '&refresh=true' + '&authenticity_token=' + encodeURIComponent('998xNxxtwXywQpQ5cZIbYJt/YWlk7CJQyLkGoAHBJQmr+M8fEGHPUFcKuMc4DUL01+O6Y1XaTW1JE2v0ljkj8w==')})
  }
//]]>
</script>

      $('bookCover_25810226').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_25810226').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_25810226').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_25810226').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_25572802').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_25572802').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_25572802').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_25572802').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_79365').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_79365').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_79365').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_79365').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_27248586').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_27248586').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_27248586').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_27248586').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_27415870').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_27415870').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_27415870').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_27415870').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_25241707').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_25241707').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_25241707').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_25241707').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

      $('bookCover_25814105').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_25814105').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_25814105').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_25814105').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });

</script>

      <div id="aboutAuthor" class=" clearFloats bigBox"><div class="h2Container gradientHeaderContainer"><h2 class="brownBackground"><a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson">About Kelly Thompson</a></h2></div><div class="bigBoxBody"><div class="bigBoxContent containerWithHeaderContent">
          <div class='bookAuthorProfile'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__topContainer'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__photoContainer'>
<a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson"><div class='bookAuthorProfile__photo' style='background-image: url(https://images.gr-assets.com/authors/1423557636p3/6543330.jpg);'></div>
</a></div>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__widgetContainer'>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__name'>
<a href="/author/show/6543330.Kelly_Thompson">Kelly Thompson
</a></div>
<div class='goodreadsAuthorBadge'></div>
<div class='bookAuthorProfile__followerCount'>
348
followers

<div class='bookAuthorProfile__about'>

<span id="freeTextContainer10440188155323682662">KELLY THOMPSON has a degree in Sequential Art from The Savannah College of Art &amp; Design. Her love of comics and superheroes have compelled her since she first discovered them as a teenager. Currently living in Portland, Oregon with her boyfriend and the two brilliant cats that run their lives, you can find Kelly all over the Internet where she is generally well liked, except where she's detest</span>
  <span id="freeText10440188155323682662" style="display:none">KELLY THOMPSON has a degree in Sequential Art from The Savannah College of Art &amp; Design. Her love of comics and superheroes have compelled her since she first discovered them as a teenager. Currently living in Portland, Oregon with her boyfriend and the two brilliant cats that run their lives, you can find Kelly all over the Internet where she is generally well liked, except where she's detested.<br /><br />Kelly has published two novels - THE GIRL WHO WOULD BE KING (2012) and STORYKILLER (2014) and the graphic novel HEART IN A BOX from Dark Horse Comics (2015). She's currently writing ROGUE &amp; GAMBIT, HAWKEYE, and PHASMA for Marvel Comics and GHOSTBUSTERS for IDW. Other major credits include: A-Force, Captain Marvel &amp; The Carol Corps, Jem and The Holograms, Misfits, Power Rangers Pink, and the creator-owned mini-series Mega Princess.<br /><br />Kelly's ambitions are eclipsed only by her desire to exist entirely in pajamas. Fortunately pajamas and writers go hand in hand (most of the time). Please buy all her stuff so that she can buy (and wear) more pajamas.</span>
  <a data-text-id="10440188155323682662" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>

</div>
</div>

      $('bookCover_29844757').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_29844757').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_29844757').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;

            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });

          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });

      $('bookCover_33275768').observe('prototip:shown', function() {
        if (this.up('#box')) {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});
        } else {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});
        }
      });

      newTip['wrapper'].addClassName('prototipAllowOverflow');

        $('bookCover_33275768').observe('prototip:shown', function () {
          $$('div.prototip').each(function (e) {
            if ($('bookCover_33275768').hasClassName('ignored')) {
              e.setStyle({'display': 'none'});
              return;
            }
            e.setStyle({'overflow': 'visible'});
          });
        });
      $('bookCover_33275768').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {
        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {
          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {
            var lessLink = e.next();
            swapContent(lessLink);
          }
        });
      });
